sentences.english: But, when the hunter falls in love with prey, his inexorable doom often starts accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当猎人爱上猎物的时候，他的劫数常因此肇始。

sentences.english: Chinese modern press industry started from the press hold by the foreigners in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国近代报刊业，肇始于外国人在华创办的报刊。

sentences.english: The counter-claim system comes from the ancient Roman law.
sentences.chinese: 反诉制度肇始于古代罗马法。

sentences.english: Bahrain's legal system appeared in the Safavid Dynasty in the 16th century.
sentences.chinese: 巴林现代法律制度肇始于16世纪的萨法维王朝。

sentences.english: It is generally believed that teaching of the English language in China began with Tong Wen Guan (The Imperial College of Translators).
sentences.chinese: 人们一般认为中国学校英语教学肇始于京师同文馆。

sentences.english: This would be the beginning of the end.
sentences.chinese: 这或许就是终结的肇始。

sentences.english: I am in favor of the Chung on China's views on the onset of modern folklore.
sentences.chinese: 我很赞成钟先生关于中国现代民俗学的肇始的见解。

sentences.english: The Imperial Granary edition The Peony Pavilion offers a concept of returning to the original state of Kunqu Opera.
sentences.chinese: 皇家粮仓版《牡丹亭》以复归昆曲肇始状态的理念。

sentences.english: There was the period of initiation of Modern educational system in the early 20st Century.
sentences.chinese: 二十世纪初年正是近代中国新式教育体系肇始之期。

sentences.english: The economics starts with the politics.
Pan Tianshou's drawing is one kind of tendency beginning, a movement initiation.
sentences.chinese: 潘天寿的绘画是一种倾向的开端，一个运动的肇始。

definition: lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
to build (for the first time)/to create (a building)
to give rise to (sth good)/to emanate from
to originate from/to come from the fact that/owing to/because of
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
there is a reason for it/(of sth) not incidental
